org.qbroker.net

Class QMFRequester

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qbroker.net.QMFRequester
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connector, Requester
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QMFMessenger

    public class QMFRequester
extends java.lang.Object
implements Requester
    QMFRequester connects to a generic QMF server for QMF requests. Currently, it supports the methods of list, getValues and getResponse for QPid only.

    It requires qpid-client.jar, qpid-common.jar, slf4-api.jar, slf4-log4j12,jar and Java 6 to compile.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

      • getResponse

        public int getResponse(java.lang.String qmfCmd,
              java.lang.StringBuffer strBuf,
              boolean autoDisconn)
                throws WrapperException
        This takes a QMF query command and converts it into a QMF request. It sends the request to the destination and returns the number of items filled in the given string buffer. The content in the string buffer is a JSON. If the disconnect flag is set to true, it disconnects right before it returns. Otherwise, it will keep the connection.

        The QMF command is supposed to be as follows:
        DISPLAY Target attr0:attr1:attr2

        In case of a fatal failure, it disconnects first and then throws a WrapperException with cause set to the vendor specific exception or IO related exception. Therefore please make sure to get the cause exception from it and handles the cause exception with care. For other failures, it throws an IllegalArgumentException. If the disconnect flag is set to true, it disconnects right before it throws the exception.
        Specified by:
        getResponse in interface Requester
        Throws:
        WrapperException
